alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 14 at 6:23AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Warning for the following areas: the Eastern Sierra in Mono County and the Eastern Sierra in Inyo County * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area is HIGH at all elevations. Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to continue through at least 7 am on Wednesday March 15th. * WHERE...Eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada Between Bishop Creek and Virginia Lakes. * WHEN...in effect until 7 am PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snowfall, rain on snow, and strong winds will overload the snowpack, which contains buried persistent weak layers. Travel will be difficult and very dangerous. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
